Existing secondary works merely begin, however, to explore the court policies and entrenched institutions contributing to Li's deteriorating military capacity. Among non-Chinese sources there are, for example, at least two French versions (Ferdinand Lecomte and Captain Armengaud) of how the Chinese won their surprise victory at Langson late in March 1885. James G. Scott, the British observer, provides concrete details in his 1886 article, 'The Chinese brave'.
